The AllocCapFile method preallocates a capture file to a specified size. For best results, always capture to a defragmented, preallocated capture file that is larger than the size of the capture data.

The FindInterface method searches the graph for a specified interface, starting from a specified filter. You can restrict the search to a section of the graph upstream or downstream of the filter, or restrict it to a particular pin category or media type.

member.param:

&LOOK_DOWNSTREAM_ONLY.

NULL
See Remarks for more information.

Pointer to the interface of the filter. The method begins searching from this filter.
Interface identifier (IID) of the interface to locate.

returns.para: Returns an HRESULT value. Possible values include the following.

The FindPin method retrieves a particular pin on a filter, or determines whether a given pin matches the specified criteria.

member.param: Pointer to an interface on a filter, or to an interface on a pin.
Member of the enumeration that specifies the pin direction (input or output).
A pointer to a GUID that specifies one of the pin categories listed in Pin Property Set. To match any pin, regardless of category, set this parameter to NULL.
Pointer to a major type GUID that specifies the media type. Use NULL to match any media type.
Boolean value that specifies whether the pin must be unconnected. If TRUE, the pin must be unconnected. If FALSE, the pin can be connected or unconnected.

Zero-based index of the pin to retrieve, from the set of matching pins. If pSource is a pointer to a filter, and more than one pin matches the search criteria, this parameter specifies which pin to retrieve. If pSource is a pointer to a pin, this parameter is ignored.
Address of a pointer to receive the interface of the matching pin.
member.returns: Returns S_OK if a matching pin is found, or E_FAIL otherwise.

The RenderStream method connects an output pin on a source filter to a sink filter, optionally through an intermediate filter.

param.name: pCategory
param.para: A pointer to a GUID that specifies one of the pin categories listed in Pin Property Set. To match any pin, regardless of category, set this parameter to NULL. Typical values include the following.

member.param: Pointer to a major-type GUID that specifies the media type of the output pin; or NULL to use any pin, regardless of media type. For a list of possible values, see Major Types.
Specifies a pointer to the starting filter for the connection, or to an output pin.
Pointer to the interface of an intermediate filter, such as a compression filter. Can be NULL.
Pointer to the IBaseFilter interface of a sink filter, such as a renderer or mux filter. If the value is NULL, the method uses a default renderer (see Remarks).

returns.para: Returns an HRESULT value. Possible return values include the following.

listheader.description: Preview was rendered through the Smart Tee Filter.

A filter is not in the filter graph. This error can occur if you did not call AddFilter to add pSource, pIntermediate, or pSink to the graph. It can also occur if you did not call SetFiltergraph to connect your graph to the Capture Graph Builder; in this case, the Capture Graph Builder object automatically creates its own filter graph. See About the Capture Graph Builder.
